Package com.notkamui.javaisyou.engine.manager

Class LevelManager

java.lang.Object
com.notkamui.javaisyou.engine.manager.LevelManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
MovementObserver
public final class LevelManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements MovementObserver
A class that represents and manages ONE level and can manipulate its state. A LevelManager knows the width and height of the board and contains a DisplayManager and a RuleManager in addition to the Model of the level.

    • LevelManager

      public LevelManager​(int width, int height, java.util.List<BoardElement> boardElements, java.util.List<Rule> defaultRules)
      Constructor for the LevelManager
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the board
      height - the height of the board
      boardElements - the list of board elements of the level
      defaultRules - the list of default rules (that cannot be broken)

  • Method Details

    • displayGame

      public void displayGame​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics, int x, int y, int windowWidth, int windowHeight)
      Renders and displays a frame
      Parameters:
      graphics - the graphic engine zone
      x - the x coordinate of the top left corner
      y - the y coordinate of the top left corner
      windowWidth - the width of the viewport
      windowHeight - the height of the viewport

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the state of the game. - Updates the rules - Applies each rule - Updates the state of each elements - Removes all dead elements from the board

    • tryToMove

      public boolean tryToMove​(BoardElement movingElement, Movement move)
      Description copied from interface: MovementObserver
      Attempts to move a given BoardElement
      Specified by:
      tryToMove in interface MovementObserver
      Parameters:
      movingElement - the element to move
      move - the actual move
      Returns:
      true if the move is successful, false otherwise

    • checkGameStatus

      public GameStatus checkGameStatus()
      Checks the status of the game
      Returns:
      the current GameStatus of the game (ONGOING, WIN or LOSE)
